events.event_name: S&P Global Canada Composite PMI Release (January 2026)
events.description: The release of the S&P Global Canada Composite PMI data for January 2026, showing a contraction in private sector activity.

facts.fact_text: The S&P Global Canada Composite PMI recorded 46.4 in January 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: The S&P Global Canada Composite PMI recorded 46.4 in January 2026, down from 46.7 in December

facts.fact_text: The services sector PMI fell to 45.8 from 46.5.
New business volumes declined for a fourteenth consecutive month.

evidences.evidence_text: New business volumes declined for a fourteenth consecutive month

facts.fact_text: Employment contracted for a fifth successive month.

evidences.evidence_text: Employment contracted for a fifth successive month, albeit modestly

facts.fact_text: Input cost inflation reached its softest rise since November 2024.

evidences.evidence_text: input cost inflation softened to its softest rise since November 2024

claims.claim_text: The services sector was the primary driver of the overall private sector downturn.
claims.author: S&P Global

evidences.evidence_text: services fell to 45.8 from 46.5, with the latter the main driver of the downturn

claims.claim_text: Business confidence remained well below the historical trend.
claims.author: S&P Global

evidences.evidence_text: Business confidence softened since December and remained well below trend

claims.claim_text: Firms were easily able to manage their workloads due to decreasing backlogs.
claims.author: S&P Global

evidences.evidence_text: Backlogs of work decreased markedly again as firms were easily able to keep on top of workloads

evidence.evidence_text: New business volumes declined for a fourteenth consecutive month and continued to weigh on output
services fell to 45.8 from 46.5, with the latter the main driver of the downturn
Employment contracted for a fifth successive month, albeit modestly, as firms pared staff or chose not to replace leavers
On the price front input cost inflation softened to its softest rise since November 2024
